intro: Hieracium galesii, commonly known as the Scottish cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the British Isles. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy habitats and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. It produces yellowish to brownish flowers that bloom in early summer. Hieracium galesii is often found in heathlands and along the edges of woodland areas.
